column4: (typing from desktop pc win7) just installed and finished updates for HP-G60 laptop ubuntu 10.10 x64. There is no wifi link available. As in the wifi doesnt even exist. Not sure what to do here?
(typing from desktop pc win7) just installed and finished updates for HP-G60 laptop ubuntu 10.10 x64. There is no wifi link available. As in the wifi doesnt even exist. Not sure what to do here?
(typing from desktop pc win7) just installed and finished updates for HP-G60 laptop ubuntu 10.10 x64. There is no wifi link available. As in the wifi doesnt even exist. Not sure what to do here?
similar thing but on natty, linux-firmware?
does your panel applet saying "missing firmware"?
ok, wifi is there, where is problem?
i cannot enable wifi, the button is red instead of blue, and im not certain as how to enable wifi through linux (learning still)
and there is no wifi tray app saying i can connect to networks
i have no idea how to do kde
An instance of nm-applet is already running.
ok, try first iwlist wlan0 scanning
wlan0     Failed to read scan data : Network is down, also the network tray app says wifi is disabled
the terminal was sitting on the process not completing it. i closed terminal and the tray disappeared..
i assume your whole panel is gone
gnome-panel --replace, do not close it yet
sorry i should have been clearer. there i sno nm-applet
ok, lets fix panel: Alt-F2 gnome-panel --replace
ok, install rfkill, and run rfkill list
i need to test own nm-applet
What applet you do have? Did you try to add it back to panel?
0: hp-wifi: Wireless LAN  Soft blocked: yes  Hard blocked: yes 1: phy0: Wireless LAN  Soft blocked: yes  Hard blocked: yes
back to applets, right click on panel and - add to panel
ok i put in gconftool --recursive-unset /apps/panel && killall gnome-panel
and it killed the panel nothing came back
same trick like last time, terminal to replace panel and Alt-F2 to free terminal
ok i have everything back up and running, nm-applet is back also
i cant with the button or the nm-applet
do you have and well hidden swith on your laptop?

physical button on laptop to enable/disable wireless you mean? if so i do have one by the power button. and it wont change colors to blue indicating it is on. and will not do anything in linux when pressed. works 30 minutes ago in windows
the "blue" controls, those with Fn? and is rfkill list react to pressing switch nest to power button?
no it is it's own seperate button to press, no fn button necessary
Intel Corporation PRO/Wireless 5100 AGN [Shiloh] Network Connection
ifup: failed to open statefile /var/run/network/ifstate: Permission denied
ok, rfkill list than press wifi button and rfkill list
hardblocked went from no to yes
hardblock is now no, what is the command to change softblock?
ok both are no now. but applet still says disabled
looks like your switch is off, back in ten, self testing
ok, have foggest idea, what about rebootnig to win to see if it works?
i just over-wrote win with linux because it was getting bogged down. but i assure you wifi worked before i put linux on the laptop
well, nothing better that to try it.
ok i can in just a moment...
